Background.text:
Inclusion criteria is
blunt neck trauma
99.6% sensitive for a clinically important injury (only 12.9% Sp)
Only 8.6% of patients were elderly in the initial study; use caution in applying to elderly
Nexus does not risk stratify based on age like CCR
Small studies show elderly patients with c-spine fractures do not often have midline tenderness

NEXUS_Cervical_Spine_Rule.text:
Radiography is not necessary if the patient satisfies
ALL
of the following low risk criteria:
No midline cervical tenderness
No focal neuro deficits
Normal alertness
No intoxication
No painful distracting injury
C-spine imaging should be considered unless the patient meets all of the above low risk criteria
